page.title: 08COLLEY HILL - REIGATE
page.content: Colley Hill is{National Trust land,which pupils from Micklefield School visited in June. At the foot of the{chalk uplands}we saw ash, beech, hawthorn, sycamore & field maple trees. On our way up the slippery slope, we saw buttercups, daisies, cowslips & clover. Some of the more{unusual {flowers}we discovered had names like bird's foot, trefoil, herb robert, milkwort, gladdyn, ladies' slipper, jack-by-the-hedge & burnet saxifrage. As we explored, we found scabious, thyme & black bryony together with plants growing abundantly such as cow parsley, dandelion, old man's beard and marguerite. We spotted rabbits, a roman snail & a grass snake, & we heard a cuckoo but unfortunately we did not find{orchids}which can be seen on Colley Hill.
